fields.summary: [C++] endianness check does not work on Solaris

comments.body: Thank you for raising the issue. I can address this, too.

I have no idea, this isn't an area (neither endianness nor Solaris) that I have much experience with. If you think that's sufficient I can try it (it doesn't seem easy to set up Solaris on public CI but I have access to a VM).
I see. Could you please try this code by applying a patch by hand? Or, should I create a PR as WIP?
[~npr] Is there any update on this?
Sorry, haven't had the chance to try this yet, will try today and report back.

This patch does seem to solve the endian check, though the build fails further down (cpp/src/arrow/vendored/portable-snippets/safe-math.h fails with "_Bool does not name a type"). I can put up a PR with this fix and make a new JIRA for the next issue.
fast_float has the same issue (in our vendored copy) so I've submitted the patch upstream there too: https://github.com/fastfloat/fast_float/pull/59
